name: Project Saikiran
tagline: An Online Retail Management and Custommer Order Processing System
body:
### Welcome to Saikiran BookStore App.
An Online retail Management and Order Processing System: By Chirag Pandit - deadnight7.github.com
Follow the Documentation or the blackbook here at 
http://www.4shared.com/office/AEf2a-PW/Binder2.html 
###### Skip over to Pg. 62 for the visual usage.

# Features
### For the users
* A full fledged online retail website system using java technologies
* Frontend supported with HTML5 and CSS3
* Images used as resources only when they are in a real need For Eg. A product informational purpose
* Product image gallery for both the use cases admin/client
...
### For the store managers / store keepers / administrators
* Quick dashboard views,
* Dashboard consists of the monthly sales and reporting charts powered by google charts
  * Some of the charts include
  * Top most view products
  * Top sold products
  * The monthly sales revenue and purchases being made by the store

# Prerequisites
Must be having on the client computer before installation

1. A copy of JDK/JRE + Netbeans 7.x+ available here at http://netbeans.org/downloads/
2. A built in or external container like Apache Tomcat 7.x+ available here at http://tomcat.apache.org
3. MySQL Database with the same name as the project, (Use an Xampp)
   * Given the MySQL File (.sql) Under jLibs directory of project root, Import the file into your database and you have your tables ready
   * Configuring Apache Server along with MySQL will be probably s system like mine for using phpMyAdmin
4. Try to change the username and passwords as per your database users for both of the file DB_Comm in packages database and cart respectively
5. Clean the project, Build the project and deploy it into the container
6. Resolve the referencing problems if any by adding the project Server Apache Tomcat and/or the jLibs directory under the project root
7. Run your project copy
8. Customize the products and users as per your requirement
9. Done you can now simply have your copy in production with hosting anywhere inside the tomcat container
### If possible do contribute to the project by testing and reporting it back at the same plcae at github if you think it is worth use of anyone
```
